thread.title: Train strikes car, intoxicated man flees the scene: Rocky River Police Blotter
thread.title_full: Train strikes car, intoxicated man flees the scene: Rocky River Police Blotter | cleveland.com

author: Julie A. Short, Correspondent
title: Train strikes car, intoxicated man flees the scene: Rocky River Police Blotter
text:
Intoxicated, Elmwood Road: A car was reported struck by a train at a gate crossing on Oct. 2 at 4:30 a.m. The driver of the car left and was later found in the backyard of a residence on Wagar Road. He was arrested and charged with disorderly conduct while intoxicated.
Julie A. Short
 Theft, Purnell Road: A man was reported entering a car. He was arrested.
Theft, Orchard Grove: A 2013 Hyundai Sonata was stolen from the driveway. Several other unlocked cars were entered during the week with various items stolen.
Theft, Center Ridge Road: A license plate was stolen from a Subaru while parked at King Wah restaurant.
Disorderly conduct: An intoxicated guest was arrested after refusing to leave a home.
Prostitution, Hampton Road: A car was stopped after an officer observed suspicious behavior at a Center Ridge Road ATM. The three occupants of the car did not provide reasonable explanations about their behavior. After an investigation, it was discovered that a woman passenger agreed to sex for money with a man, and the three were driving to the ATM to retrieve payment. All three occupants were charged with prostitution related offenses.
